resources.name: Step 1. Sign Up
resources.description:
*You don't need to authenticate this api*

Basically, the first step is to provide the way we will identify you: by either email address or phone number.

> ***Attention**: if you create a new profile by email and after you try to create another profile by using your phone number, we will create two different profiles in the database*

> **Obs**: You should request this API once again for cases that users say they didn't receive the confirmation code. In this case, the frontend can have an option saying "Send me the code again" and asks users to double check their information.

# Request Body

    {
    	"identifier":"john.lennon@cxwow.com",
        "magicLinkUrl":"https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code="
    }

### Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|identifier*     | string                        |A valid email address or phone number|
|magicLinkUrl    | string                        |(optional) We will send a message to the user concatenating the link with the confirmation code. For Example: "magicLinkUrl":"https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=", in this case, the user will receive a message in their email/cellphone saying the confirmation code plus "If you prefer, click on https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=ABCDEF to sign in"|

# Response

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | A code has been sent to the profile (email or sms)|
|401          | You get this error when the email or phone number is invalid|

*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

# Welcome to Cxwow API Documentation

This is the official Cxwow API documentation for internal developers, that means you cannot share it with people who don't work on DFO.

You will find two environments in this version - **Local** and **Development**. The first one should be used for backend developers who need to run the APIs from their own machine, pointing out to their localhost, the second one should be used for frontend integration and testers in general.

Be aware of the current baseUrl for the selected environment: {{ _.API_GATEWAY_HOST }}.

## General Instructions

There are multiple workflows and authorization levels for each API. Because of that, we thought it would be nice to split the APIs into **workspace profile type** - right now we have three: **Owner**, **Admin** and **Associate**.

What do you mean by **workspace profile type**? The authorization level depends on the workspace: the same profile type can be **owner**** in a workspace, and **associate** in another workspace for example.

### Workspace Profile Types

**Owner**: someone is a owner when they create a new workspace for they company. Owners can only leave a workspace when they transfer the ownership to another person. Owners inherits Admin permissions.

**Admin**: someone is admin when they are invited to a workspace to be admin. Admin can change Workspace Settings, assign inquiries to associates, approve new requests, invite people to the workspace, etc.

**Associate**: someone who will receive inquiries and answer them (aka Customer Service Agents).

resources.name: Step 2. Enter Confirmation Code
Step 1. Is domain available? (Optional)
resources.description:
*You need, at least, a temporary token to access this endpoint. Otherwise, you will get 401 (Unauthorized)*

This step is optional. Basically, you can check if the domain is available before you take it. Simple like that.

## Request URL

### GET /workspace/check/:domain

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|domain          | string                        |The domain you want to check whether is available or not|

#### Examples

GET /workspace/check/cocacola

GET /workspace/check/nike

GET /workspace/check/dfo

GET /workspace/check/emanagecrm

GET /workspace/check/cxwow

## Response Example

    {
	    "result": false
    }

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|result          | boolean                       |Return if the domain is available or not|

### Black List

There is a domains black list embedded in the backend that does not allow you to take them.

#### Examples

GET /workspace/search/df

    {

			],
			"totalDocs": 1,
			"limit": 10,
			"totalPages": 1,
			"page": 1,
			"pagingCounter": 1,
			"hasPrevPage": false,
			"hasNextPage": false,
			"prevPage": null,
			"nextPage": null

### Docs result

Inside the property `docs`, it returns a collection of `workspace`. Please, check the section **Common > Entities > `Workspace`**

resources.name: Step 2: Create Workspace: First Tab - Basic Info
resources.description:
*You need, at least, a temporary token to access this endpoint. Otherwise, you will get 401 (Unauthorized)*

You only need the workspace domain to create a workspace in CXwow.

Of course, you should fill in the other fields to complete your workspace profile, they are optional technically speaking though. The only field you must send in all request is **`domain`**.

That being said, let's say you only want to disable a workspace. You just need to send:

    {
      "domain":"dfo",
      "isEnabled": false
    }

As you can see, domain is the key to identify the company along the database collections.

In the wireframe we have a small workflow that guides users to complete their workspace profile, so we are splitting the requests into many steps for reference purpose - but it does not matter for the backend though.

It's up to you to send all workspace information at once, or in minor pieces - like in the wireframe.

Check the section **Common > Entities > `Workspace`** to see all the parameters available

## Request URL

### POST /workspace

## Request Body

    {
	    "domain": "dfo"	
    }


|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|domain     | string                        |The workspace domain at CXwow - Ex: dfo.cxwow.com, dfo is the workspace domain|

## Response Example

The `workspace` object. See more at **Common > Entities > `Workspace`**

    {
		"domain": "dfo",
		"id": "62d9b3802dacae5f1f8a3385",
		"contacts": [],
		"companyOwners": [],
		"references": [],
		"isEnabled": true,
		"createdBy": "62d9b2ec2dacae5f1f8a336c",
		"createdAt": 1658434432661
    }

*Content updated at: **2022/07/28**

resources.name: Alternative 1
resources.description:
## Signing in at https://www.cxwow.com

Basically, there are three steps to sign in:
1) Step 1: provide users identifier (either email or phone number). We will send a confirmation code right after that.
2) Step 2: provide the confirmation code + identifier (either email or phone number). We will return a list of domains and invitations that you are allowed to interact + a temporary token. In the frontend, you should show a list of domains, so users can choose where they want to login.
3) Step 3: provide the temporary token + the domain you want to sign in.

*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.description:

You have two alternatives to sign in:

2) **Alternative 2** From the workspace subdomain (ex: https://dfo.cxwow.com)

Step 3: Sign in to Workspace by Temporary Token
resources.description:
*You need a temporary token to go on*

You must authenticate this API by using the temporary token that you got in the previous step, so we will return a permanent one.

# Request Body

    {
	    "temporaryToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0eXBlIjoiQkVGT1JFX1dPUktTUEFDRSIsImlkZW50aWZpZXIiOiJldmFuZHJvLnZlbmFuY2lvQG91dGxvb2suY29tIiwiaWQiOiI2MmJmNmMyZjFmZTYwM2M2YmM5ZWIyZjgiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTg0MjYxNDYsImV4cCI6MTY1OTAyNjE0Nn0.gGfNMEbXiJUpDBJuPerTb4S3WV6ZYox-E_dND14BXYA"
    }

### Request Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|temporaryToken      | string                        |Temporary token that you get in the Step 2 of this section|

# Response Example

    {
        "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0eXBlIjoiQkVGT1JFX1dPUktTUEFDRSIsImlkZW50aWZpZXIiOiJldmFuZHJvLnZlbmFuY2lvQG91dGxvb2suY29tIiwiaWQiOiI2MmJmNmMyZjFmZTYwM2M2YmM5ZWIyZjgiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTgyNTEyNjIsImV4cCI6MTY1ODg1MTI2Mn0.MQPyrXEdQWiZWqLvV-WvwmkD_LHq66Bb49SWSNsoLPg"
    }

# Response Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|token      | string              |A permanent token that you can store in their localStorage/cookie for next usages|

# Error Messages & Http Codes

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | The request went through and you should get a permament token|
|401          | The token or email is invalid, and you should ask client to try again|


*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.description:
This is API is supposed to be requested in the subdomain page of a workspace. For example: https://dfo.cxwow.com, where dfo is the `:domain` of a workspace.

That's why you must provider `:domain` as a parameter in the URL:

**GET /profile/signin/:domain**

### Examples:

GET /profile/signin/dfo

GET /profile/signin/cocacola

GET /profile/signin/emanagecrm


Provide the way we will identify you: by either email address or phone number.

> **Obs**: You should request this API once again for cases that users say they didn't receive the confirmation code. In this case, the frontend can have an option saying "Send me the code again" and asks users to double check their information.

For Example: "magicLinkUrl":"https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=", in this case, the user will receive a message in their email/cellphone saying the confirmation code plus "If you prefer, click on https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=ABCDEF to sign in"|

resources.name: Alternative 2
resources.description:
## Signing in to a workspace domain (https://<workspace_domain>.cxwow.com)

There are only two steps ahead:
1) Step 1: provide users identifier (either email or phone number). We will send a confirmation code right after that.
2) Step 2: provide the confirmation code + identifier (either email or phone number). We will return a permanent token for you.

*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.name: Step 2: Enter Confirmation Code to Workspace
resources.description:
*You don't need to authenticate this api*

Let's say the user is already in the workspace domain, for example, https://dfo.cxwow.com - so you already know that they want to login in DFO, so we don't need to show the domain list, and you can validate the confirmation code against the domain directly, we will return a permanent token.

You just need to provide the same identifier that you use in the step 1 + the confirmation code you received.

Also, you must inform the `:domain` parameter in the endpoint

** GET profile/signin/confirmationCode/:domain **

If valid, we will return a permanent token that you can store in the localStorage/cookie for calling other APIs.


# Request Body

    {
	    "identifier":"john.lennon@cxwow.com",
	    "confirmationCode": "008435"
    }

### Request Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|identifier      | string                        |A valid email address or phone number|
|confirmationCode| string                        |Six-Random Numeric Digit. For the development environment, it never expires. For the production environment, it expires after 10 minutes   |

# Response Example

    {
        "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0eXBlIjoiQkVGT1JFX1dPUktTUEFDRSIsImlkZW50aWZpZXIiOiJldmFuZHJvLnZlbmFuY2lvQG91dGxvb2suY29tIiwiaWQiOiI2MmJmNmMyZjFmZTYwM2M2YmM5ZWIyZjgiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTgyNTEyNjIsImV4cCI6MTY1ODg1MTI2Mn0.MQPyrXEdQWiZWqLvV-WvwmkD_LHq66Bb49SWSNsoLPg"
    }

# Response Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|token      | string              |It's a permanent token that you can store in their localStorage/cookie for next usages|

# Error Messages & Http Codes

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | The request went through and you should get a permament token|
|401          | The token or email is invalid, and you should ask client to try again|


*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

        "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0eXBlIjoiQkVGT1JFX1dPUktTUEFDRSIsImlkZW50aWZpZXIiOiJldmFuZHJvLnZlbmFuY2lvQG91dGxvb2suY29tIiwiaWQiOiI2MmJmNmMyZjFmZTYwM2M2YmM5ZWIyZjgiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTgyNTEyNjIsImV4cCI6MTY1ODg1MTI2Mn0.MQPyrXEdQWiZWqLvV-WvwmkD_LHq66Bb49SWSNsoLPg"
    }

# Response Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|

# Error Messages & Http Codes

|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | The request went through and you should get a permament token|
|401          | The token or email is invalid, and you should ask client to try again|

resources.name: Step 1. Sign In to Workspace
resources.description:
This is API is supposed to be requested in the subdomain page of a workspace. For example: https://dfo.cxwow.com, where dfo is the `:domain` of a workspace.

That's why you must provider `:domain` as a parameter in the URL:

**GET /profile/signin/:domain**

### Examples:

GET /profile/signin/dfo

GET /profile/signin/cocacola

GET /profile/signin/emanagecrm


Provide the way we will identify you: by either email address or phone number.

> **Obs**: You should request this API once again for cases that users say they didn't receive the confirmation code. In this case, the frontend can have an option saying "Send me the code again" and asks users to double check their information.

# Request Body

    {
    	"identifier":"john.lennon@cxwow.com",
        "magicLinkUrl":"https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code="
    }

### Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|identifier*     | string                        |A valid email address or phone number|
|magicLinkUrl    | string                        |(optional) We will send a message to the user concatenating the link with the confirmation code. For Example: "magicLinkUrl":"https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=", in this case, the user will receive a message in their email/cellphone saying the confirmation code plus "If you prefer, click on https://www.cxwow.com/auth?code=ABCDEF to sign in"|

# Response

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | A code has been sent to the profile (email or sms)|
|401          | You get this error when the email or phone number is invalid|

*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.name: Alternative 2
resources.description:
## Signing in to a workspace domain (https://<workspace_domain>.cxwow.com)

There are only two steps ahead:
1) Step 1: provide users identifier (either email or phone number). We will send a confirmation code right after that.
2) Step 2: provide the confirmation code + identifier (either email or phone number). We will return a permanent token for you.

*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.name: Step 2: Enter Confirmation Code to Workspace
resources.description:
*You don't need to authenticate this api*

Let's say the user is already in the workspace domain, for example, https://dfo.cxwow.com - so you already know that they want to login in DFO, so we don't need to show the domain list, and you can validate the confirmation code against the domain directly, we will return a permanent token.

You just need to provide the same identifier that you use in the step 1 + the confirmation code you received.

Also, you must inform the `:domain` parameter in the endpoint

** GET profile/signin/confirmationCode/:domain **

If valid, we will return a permanent token that you can store in the localStorage/cookie for calling other APIs.


# Request Body

    {
	    "identifier":"john.lennon@cxwow.com",
	    "confirmationCode": "008435"
    }

### Request Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|identifier      | string                        |A valid email address or phone number|
|confirmationCode| string                        |Six-Random Numeric Digit. For the development environment, it never expires. For the production environment, it expires after 10 minutes   |

# Response Example

    {
        "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0eXBlIjoiQkVGT1JFX1dPUktTUEFDRSIsImlkZW50aWZpZXIiOiJldmFuZHJvLnZlbmFuY2lvQG91dGxvb2suY29tIiwiaWQiOiI2MmJmNmMyZjFmZTYwM2M2YmM5ZWIyZjgiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTgyNTEyNjIsImV4cCI6MTY1ODg1MTI2Mn0.MQPyrXEdQWiZWqLvV-WvwmkD_LHq66Bb49SWSNsoLPg"
    }

# Response Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|token      | string              |It's a permanent token that you can store in their localStorage/cookie for next usages|

# Error Messages & Http Codes

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | The request went through and you should get a permament token|
|401          | The token or email is invalid, and you should ask client to try again|


*Content updated at: **2022/07/21**

resources.name: Customer Lookup
resources.description:
*You are required to authenticate this api*

Search customers by certain parameters

> *It supports `pagination`. See more at **Common > Entities > `Pagination`***

### Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|page    | int                        |Page to fetch from |
|limit    | int                        |Page size (items to show per page) |

### Query Parameters

Sample URL: GET /widget/ecrm/customer/{page}/{count}?OrderNumber=&AddressStreet=&AddressCity=&AddressZip=&CustomerEmail=evandro.venancio%40dfo.global&CustomerFirstName=&CustomerMiddleName=&CustomerLastName=&CustomerPhone=&Blacklisted=&TrackingNumber=&MasterOrderNumber=

You can use this route to filter data according your needs. There are a lot of filters that you can combine to meet your criteria.

|Filter          |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|OrderNumber      | |
|AddressStreet      | |
|AddressCity      | |
|AddressZip      | |
|CustomerEmail      | |
|CustomerFirstName      | |
|CustomerMiddleName      | |
|CustomerLastName      | |
|CustomerPhone      | |
|Blacklisted      | |
|TrackingNumber      | |

# Response

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | Operation was successful|
|401          | Missing page or limit parameter|

resources.name: Order Lookup
resources.description:
*You are required to authenticate this api*

Search Customers by Query Params

### Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|page    | int                        |Page to fetch from |
|limit    | int                        |Page size (items to show per page) |


### Query Params

Sample URL: GET /widget/ecrm/order/{page}/{count}?StartDate=2020-10-05&EndDate=2020-10-07&OrderStatus=null&Campaign=null&PaymentType=null&PaymentStatus=null&Product=null&Customer=null&OrderNumber=&OrderBehaviorId=null&ShippingReference=&LastFourDigits=&Amount=&PaymentTrackingNumber=&ShoppingCartNumber=&ShipmentTrackingNumber=

You can use this route to filter data according your needs. There are a lot of filters that you can combine to meet your criteria.


|Filter          |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|StartDate      | Format yyyy-MM-dd |
|EndDate        | Format yyyy-MM-dd |
|OrderStatus    |  |
|Campaign    |  |
|PaymentType    |  |
|PaymentStatus    |  |
|Product    |  |
|OrderNumber    |  |
|OrderBehaviorId | |
|ShippingReference | |
|LastFourDigits | |

resources.name: Tracking by tracking number
resources.description:
*You are required to authenticate this api*

Fetch tracking data by tracking number

> **Obs**: It is possible to inform either carrier tracking number or DFO's internal tracking number.

### Parameters

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|trackingNumber    | string                        |Tracking number to fetch tracking data |

# Response

|Http Code       |Description                  |
|----------------|-----------------------------|
|200          | Operation was successful|
|401          | Invalid tracking number|

resources.name: Entities
resources.description:
# Address

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|addressLine1    | string                     |First Line of the Address|
|addressLine2    | string                     |(Optional) Second Line of the Address|
|state           | string                     |State|
|city            | string                     |City|
|country         | string                     |Country|
|zipCode         | string                     |Zip Code|

# Associate

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|resumeUrl    | string                     |Resume Link URL|
|idFrontPhotoUrl | string               |Image Url of the ID Front photo|
|idBackPhotoUrl  | string                |Image Url of the ID Front photo|
|linkedinUrl    | string                   |Linkedin URL|
|facebookUrl    | string                   |Facebook Profile URL|
|taxNumberSIN    | string                  |Tax Number SIN|
|identity        | enum options: `she\her`. `he/him`, `they/them` | How the associate identifies themselves|
|bank            | dynamic json                     |It accepts any valid json to store the bank information|
|desiredHourlyPay | string                     |How much the associate wants to earn per worked hour|
|desiredComission | string                     |How much the associate wants to earn per sale|
|timezone | string                     |Which timezone the associate is available to work|

# Contact

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|name        | string                     |Name of the contact|
|title       | string                     |Title of the Contact. Ex: CEO, Sales Director, etc|
|email       | string                     |Contact Email Address|
|phoneNumber | string                     |Contact Phone Number|

# Language

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|language        | string                     |The language itself, like English, Portuguese, Vietnamese. Check the section *Common > APIs > Get Languages* to retrieve all languages available|
|proficiency       | string                     |Proficiency. Check the section *Common > APIs > Get Languages* to retrieve all proficiency levels available|
|certificates       | array of `string`                     |(Optional) Language Certificates, like IELTS, Cambridge, etc|

# Owner

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|name        | string                     |(Optional) Name of the contact|

# PaymentDetails

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|cardNumber         | string                     |Credit Card Number (we receive the full card number, however we only return the four last digits|
|expiryDate         | string                     |Format should be MM/YY, like in the credit card itself|
|cvv                | string                     |CVV|
|cardHolder         | string                     |Card Holder name|
|billingAddress     | `address`                  |The Billing Address of the Credit Card|
|isCorporateCredit  | boolean                    |true or false|

# Profile

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|email           | string                     |The profile email address. If filled in, we will send notifications for this email address.|
|phoneNumber     | string                     |The profile phone number. If filled in, we will send notifications by SMS to this number|
|isEnabled       | boolean                     |If the profile is enabled or not in Cxwow. It affects all workspaces|
|fullName       | string                     |The full name of the profile|
|profilePictureUrl       | string                     |The image we will use to show who they are in CXwow. In the external communication, we will use their avatar picture + avatar name|
|address       | `address`                     |Profile Address|
|associate       | `associate`                     |Associate Details for this profile. It only required for Associates, that means this property is optional for admins and owners|
|languages       | array of `language`                     |Languages spoken by this profile|
|createdAt       | number                     |Milliseconds since January 1, 1970. Default is now|
|lastAccess       | number                     |Milliseconds since January 1, 1970. Default is now|

# Reference

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|companyName        | string                     |Company Name|
|contactName        | string                     |Contact Name|
|email              | string                     |Contact Email Address|
|phoneNumber        | string                     |Contact Phone Number|

# Workspace

|                |Type                           |Description                  |
|----------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------|
|domain     | string                        |The workspace domain at CXwow - Ex: For https://dfo.cxwow.com, dfo is the workspace domain. You cannot change the domain after you have created. Internally, we use the workspace domain as the Shard Key for many collections, so it's fair to say that this is the main property to identify a workspace along the databases, as much important as its own id. Also, after you create a new workspace, the backend will register an email account as the root account for receiving and sending messages. For example: for https://dfo.cxwow.com we will register the email account dfo@cxwowmail.com, so the workspaces can start receiving inquiries right after the creation.|
|companyName     | string                     |(Optional) The name of the company in CXwow|
|companyAddress  | `address`                  |(Optional) The address of the company in CXwow|
|companyType     | string                     |(Optional) Company Type in CXwow|
|phoneNumber     | string                     |(Optional) The main phone number for the workspace in CXwow|
|contacts        | array of `contact`         |(Optional) A List of Workspace Contacts in CXwow|
|companyOwners   | array of `owner`           |(Optional) A List of Company Owners in CXwow|
|paymentDetails  | `paymentDetails`           |(Optional) The payment data to charge the payment models|
|references      | array of `references`      |(Optional) A List of Company References|
|isEnabled       | boolean                    |Enable/Disable a workspace in CXwow. Default is true|
|createdBy       | string                     |ProfileId of who has created the workspace in CXwow|
|createdAt       | number                     |Milliseconds since January 1, 1970. Default is now|

*Content updated at: **2022/07/28**
